thing-type.label: SHHA10000 Smart Plug, Power Switch
thing-type.description: Smart Plug, Power Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe SHHA10000 was developed for use in home automation systems that use the Z-Wave wireless standard. The power outlet enables you to switch a large number of your electronic devices - conveniently and directly via the gateway's app or automatically according to an individual schedule. In conjunction with configurable scenes, a large number of smart functions can be initiated, e.g. a presence simulation or you can preheat the coffee machine before getting up.</p&gt <p&gtThe ABUS Z-Wave SHHA10000...:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtis a wireless socket</li&gt <li&gtis Z-Wave PLUS compatible & certified</li&gt <li&gtsupports the Z-Wave S2 Standard (Security 2)</li&gt <li&gtmeasures your (current) consumption values reliably over any period of time</li&gt <li&gtdetects applied mains voltage, wattage consumption, kWh and ampere</li&gt <li&gtcan be switched on and off via app or manually</li&gt <li&gtwas developed for indoor installation</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPlug the Wireless-Socket into an outlet. The StatusLED is flashing.</li&gt <li&gtClick the + (Add) button in your Z-Wave App and follow the further instructions</li&gt <li&gtPress the Network-Button on the Socket once The App will show if the Add device process was successful The Status LED does not flash anymore but indicates if device is switched on or off Repeat the inclusion process if it was not successful.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtClick the - (Remove) button in your Z-Wave App and follow the further instructions</li&gt <li&gtPress the Button on the socket 3 times The App will show if the Remove Device process was successful. The Status-LED will now flash continuously Repeat the exclusion process if it was not successful.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Overvoltage protection
parameter.description: Enable / Disable overvoltage protection.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable / Disable overvoltage protection.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 = Enabled</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadecimal: 0x00 – 0x01)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Device status after power failure
parameter.description: Set which device status should be present after a power failure.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet which device status should be present after a power failure.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Status before power failure</li&gt <li&gt1 = Status “on”</li&gt <li&gt2 = Status “off”</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadezimal: 0x00 – 0x02)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Device status report
parameter.description: Device status report when device status changes.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDevice status report when device status changes.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 = Send report</li&gt <li&gt2 = Send report only with manual change</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadezimal: 0x00 – 0x02)</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Send report only with manual change

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: LED indicator
parameter.description: Behaviour of the LED display with device status "On".<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBehaviour of the LED display with device status "On".</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = LED is permanently active with device status "On</li&gt <li&gt1 = LED is active for 5 seconds when changing to device status "On" and then extinguishes</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadezimal: 0x00 – 0x01)</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: LED is permanently active with device status "On"

parameter.name: config_16_2
parameter.label: 16: Power report (Threshold)
parameter.description: The threshold value serves as an additional condition for the time-based report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe threshold value serves as an additional condition for the time-based report.<br /&gtIf the threshold value was not exceeded, the time-based report is not sent. <br /&gtThe value 0 deactivates the power report threshold.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtAdjustable from 0 – 65535 in Watt</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadecimal: 0x00 – 0xFFFF)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Power report (Threshold value in percent)
parameter.description: The threshold value serves as an additional condition for the time-based report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe threshold value serves as an additional condition for the time-based report. <br /&gtIf the threshold value was not exceeded, the time-based report is not sent. <br /&gtThe value 0 deactivates the power report threshold.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtAdjustable from 0 – 127 in Watt</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadecimal: 0x00 – 0x7F)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Resets parameter 101 - 104 to factory setting.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt84 = Resets parameter 101 - 104 to factory setting.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 254: Enable / Disable Configuration
parameter.description: Enables / Disables the configuration.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnables / Disables the configuration.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 = Configuration is enabled</li&gt <li&gt1 = Configuration is disabled</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt(Hexadecimal: 0x00 - 0x01)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Sending Meter Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the state of Smart Plug (turn on or off the load) is changed:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet Configuration parameter 3 to 0 (0x00): Do not send Basic Report</li&gt <li&gtSet Configuration parameter 3 to 1 (0x00): Send Basic Report</li&gt <li&gtSet Configuration parameter 3 to 2 (0x00): Send Basic Report only when Load condition is changed not by Z-WAVE Command, such as short pressing.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtSending Meter Report.</p&gt
